definition: the act of moving soldiers or weapons into a position where they are ready for military action
the act of using something effectively
the fact or process of becoming worse
an act of coming or being brought to a place
the part of an airport that you go through when you arrive on a plane
a person or thing that comes to a place
the time when a new technology or idea is introduced
(of an accident victim or other patient) already dead when arriving at a hospital
very unlikely to be successful; not working when it is delivered
likely to break; easily broken
easily broken or damaged
weak and uncertain; easy to destroy or harm
thin or light and often beautiful
not strong and likely to become ill
happening or following one after the other regularly
if something happens on alternate days, nights, etc. it happens on one day, etc. but not on the next
that can be used instead of something else
connected with strange powers of the mind and not able to be explained by natural laws
seeming to have strange mental powers and to be able to do things that are not possible according to natural laws
connected with the mind rather than the body
connected with or happening in the mind; involving the process of thinking
connected with the state of health of the mind or with the treatment of illnesses of the mind
crazy
pleasant, friendly and easy to talk to
polite, especially in a way that shows respect
a small change or improvement that is made to a document or proposed new law; the process of changing a document or proposed new law
a statement of a change to the Constitution of the US
negative and unpleasant; not likely to produce a good result
not good and likely to cause problems or make something more difficult
showing that you do not approve of or like somebody/something

a lack of agreement between facts, opinions, actions, etc.
the act of saying that something that somebody else has said is wrong or not true; an example of this
a statement containing two words that contradict each other’s meaning
a thing that shows that something else exists or is true
a formal written or spoken statement saying what you know to be true, usually in court
the quality of being willing to accept or tolerate somebody/something, especially opinions or behaviour that you may not agree with, or people who are not like you
the ability to suffer something, especially pain, difficult conditions, etc. without being harmed
the amount by which the measurement of a value can vary without causing problems
a person who owns something
the process or method of building or making something, especially roads, buildings, bridges, etc.
the people and activities involved in making buildings
the way that something has been built or made
a thing that has been built or made
the way in which words are used together and arranged to form a sentence, phrase, etc.
the creating of something from ideas, opinions and knowledge
the way in which words, actions, statements, etc. are understood by somebody
too anxious and tired to be able to relax
pronounced with emphasis
that has had a lot of physical pressure put on it
a building or set of buildings at an airport where passengers arrive and leave
a place, building or set of buildings where journeys by train, bus or boat begin or end
a piece of equipment, usually consisting of a keyboard and a screen that joins the user to a central computer system
a point at which connections can be made in an electric circuit
not allowed by the constitution of a country, a political system or an organization
connected with the buying and selling of goods and services
making or intended to make a profit
more interested in profit and being popular than in quality
paid for by the money charged for broadcasting advertisements
to make something such as an agreement or order lose its legal force
to make something lose its effect or power
having a shape like a ring
(in stories) a creature like a small person with pointed ears, who has magic powers
to give something, especially money or goods, to help achieve or provide something
to be one of the causes of something
to increase, improve or add to something
to write things for a newspaper, book, website, etc. or a radio or television programme; to speak during a meeting or conversation, especially to give your opinion
to gather together a group of people for a formal meeting
material used for making or covering roofs
the process of building roofs
the process in people, animals or plants of growing physically, mentally or emotionally
an increase in the size, amount or degree of something
an increase in economic activity
a mass of cells caused by a disease that forms on or inside a person, an animal or a plant
something that has grown
an ending of the period of time when an official document can be used, or when an agreement is legally acceptable
the process of carefully considering or discussing something
the quality of being slow and careful in what you say or do
to take away money, points, etc. from a total amount
to say something officially or publicly
to state something clearly and definitely
to say clearly and openly who you are or what you intend to do
to tell the tax authorities how much money you have earned
to tell customs officers (= at the border of a country) that you are carrying goods on which you should pay tax
to decide to end your innings (= the period during which your team is batting) before all your players have batted
to think or accept that something is true but without having proof of it
to take or begin to have power or responsibility

to pretend to have a particular feeling or quality
a piece of equipment that changes electrical signals into sound, used in public places for announcing things, playing music, etc.
a function on a phone that allows you to hear without holding the phone to your ear
the part of a radio or piece of musical equipment that the sound comes out of
the freedom for a country, a region or an organization to govern itself independently
the ability to act and make decisions without being controlled by anyone else
the process of gradually increasing or getting more and more of something over a period of time
an amount of something that has gradually increased over a period of time
in a way that lasts or is intended to last or be used only for a short time; in a way that is not permanent

a sports competition involving a number of teams or players who take part in different games and must leave the competition if they lose. The competition continues until there is only the winner left.
a competition in the Middle Ages between knights on horseback fighting to show courage and skill
a shape cut out of a hard material, used as a model for producing exactly the same shape many times in another material
a thing that is used as a model for producing other similar examples
the amount of work that is done, or the number of people that are dealt with, in a particular period of time
to explode, or to make a bomb or other device explode

a person who pays tax to the government, especially on the money that they earn
being part of the beliefs, customs or way of life of a particular group of people, that have not changed for a long time
following older methods and ideas rather than modern or different ones
a person who is responsible for the money and accounts of a club or an organization
a person who works in an office, working for another person, dealing with mail and phone calls, keeping records, arranging meetings with people, etc.
an official of a club, society, etc. who deals with mail, keeping records and making business arrangements

the head of a government department, chosen by the president
an assistant of a government minister, an ambassador, etc.
acting or done quickly and without thinking carefully about the results
the fact of no longer being involved with somebody/something or interested in them/it
the act of stopping fighting and moving away
a word or phrase used as the name of something, especially one connected with a particular type of language

a period of time for which something lasts; a fixed or limited time
the end of a particular period of time, especially one for which something is expected to last
each of the various parts in a series, an equation, etc.
used to describe what will happen a long, short, etc. time in the future

connected with the practical use of machines, methods, etc. in science and industry
connected with the skills needed for a particular job, sport, art, etc.
connected with a particular subject and therefore difficult to understand if you do not know about that subject

used to emphasize the most important part of something

likely to be successful and popular in the future
a large important organization that has a particular purpose, for example a university or bank
